article.Heading: Budget 2016: Agri, farmer welfare priority; irrigation to get Rs 17K this yr
article.Summary: In his speech, Jaitley indicated that the focus will be on infrastructure with subsequent focus on improvement in quality of life.
article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

Finance Minister, Arun Jaitley, while presenting the Union Budget 2016 today said that the Budget has been framed keeping in mind nine essential pillars that are on the government's priority list. 

In his speech, Jaitley indicated that the focus will be on infrastructure with subsequent focus on  improvement in quality of life.

Reforms in agriculture, one of the nine pillars, are dedicated towards improving productivity as well life of farmers. The government aims to double farmer income in coming years. Accelerated Irrigation Benefits Programme (AIBP) scheme has been allocated Rs 17,000 crore for FY17.

Equal focus has also been given to irrigation and organic farming. The government has set aside Rs 56,500 crore on irrigation projects for next five years. A unified agriculture market a scheme has also been introduced to enhance farmer access to markets.
